org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment

Interface Assignment<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - Variable
    T - Value
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    InheritedAssignment<V,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AssignmentAbstract, AssignmentArray, AssignmentMap, DefaultInheritedAssignment, DefaultParallelAssignment, DefaultSingleAssignment, EmptyAssignment, InheritedAssignmentArray, OptimisticInheritedAssignment

    public interface Assignment<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>>
    An assignment of all the variable of a Model. This class decouples an assignment of variables (classes extending Variable) to their values (classes extending Value) from the Model. This is needed for any kind of parallel computations, or in general, to be able to hold multiple different assignments in memory.

    This class also include translation of AssignmentContextReference to AssignmentContext, so that each constraint, criterion, neighborhood selection etc. can hold its own assignment dependent information. See ConstraintWithContext or NeighbourSelectionWithContext for more details.
    Version:
    IFS 1.3 (Iterative Forward Search)
    Copyright (C) 2014 Tomáš Müller

    Author:
    Tomáš Müller
    See Also:
    Variable, Value, Model, AssignmentContext

    • Method Detail

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Assignment index. Unique identification of the assignment, starting with zero. This can be used to increase the speed of the search by storing individual values on the variables and an array (indexed by this number).
        Returns:
        assignment index, -1 if not to be used

      • getValue

        T getValue(V variable)
        Returns assignment of a variable, null if not assigned Replacement for Variable.getAssignment().
        Parameters:
        variable - problem variable
        Returns:
        currently assigned value

      • getIteration

        long getIteration(V variable)
        Returns iteration of the last assignment. Replacement for Variable.getLastIteration().
        Parameters:
        variable - problem variable
        Returns:
        iteration of the last assignment

      • assign

        T assign(long iteration,
         T value)
        Assign the given value to its variable. Replacement for Variable.assign(int, Value).
        Parameters:
        iteration - current iteration
        value - a new value to be assigned to variable Value.variable().
        Returns:
        previous assignment of the variable, null if it was not assigned

      • unassign

        T unassign(long iteration,
           V variable)
        Unassign the given variable. Replacement for Variable.unassign(int).
        Parameters:
        iteration - current iteration
        variable - variable to be unassigned
        Returns:
        previous assignment of the variable, null if it was not assigned

      • unassign

        T unassign(long iteration,
           V variable,
           T value)
        Unassign the given variable, but only if the current assignment differs from the given value. Replacement for Variable.unassign(int).
        Parameters:
        iteration - current iteration
        variable - variable to be unassigned
        value - target value
        Returns:
        previous assignment of the variable, null if it was not assigned

      • nrAssignedVariables

        int nrAssignedVariables()
        Number of assigned variables in this assignment. Replacement for Model.nrAssignedVariables().
        Returns:
        number of assigned variables in this assignment

      • assignedVariables

        Collection<V> assignedVariables()
        The list of assigned variables in the assignment. That is all the variables that getValue(Variable) is not null in this assignment. Replacement for Model.assignedVariables().
        Returns:
        a collection of assigned variable in this assignment

      • assignedValues

        Collection<T> assignedValues()
        The list of assigned values in the assignment. That is a collection of getValue(Variable) for all assigned variables in this assignment.
        Returns:
        a collection of assigned values in this assignment

      • nrUnassignedVariables

        int nrUnassignedVariables(Model<V,T> model)
        Number of assigned variables in the assignment. Replacement for Model.nrUnassignedVariables().
        Parameters:
        model - existing model (the assignment does not keep track about all existing variables, that is what the Model.variables() is for)
        Returns:
        number of not assigned variables in this assignment

      • unassignedVariables

        Collection<V> unassignedVariables(Model<V,T> model)
        The list of variables of the model that have no value in this assignment. That is all the variables of the model that getValue(Variable) is null in this assignment. Replacement for Model.unassignedVariables()
        Parameters:
        model - existing model (the assignment does not keep track about all existing variables, that is what the Model.variables() is for)
        Returns:
        a collection of all not assigned variables in this assignment

      • getAssignmentContext

        <C extends AssignmentContext> C getAssignmentContext(AssignmentContextReference<V,T,C> reference)
        Assignment context for a reference. This can be used to keep assignment dependent computations (e.g., see ConstraintWithContext).
        Type Parameters:
        C - assignment context type
        Parameters:
        reference - a reference (which can be stored within the model, e.g., as an instance variable of a constraint)
        Returns:
        an AssignmentContext

      • clearContext

        <C extends AssignmentContext> void clearContext(AssignmentContextReference<V,T,C> reference)
        Clear an assignment context that is associated with the given a reference. If there is any created for the reference.
        Type Parameters:
        C - assignment context type
        Parameters:
        reference - a reference (which can be stored within the model, e.g., as an instance variable of a constraint)
